channel.title: CVE Feed for The Linux Kernel Organization -- linux
channel.description: The latest CVEs for The Linux Kernel Organization -- linux

item.title: CVE-2022-2586|2024-08-03T00:39:08.105Z -- the%20linux%20kernel%20organization -- linux
item.description: It was discovered that a nft object or expression could reference a nft set on a different nft table, leading to a use-after-free once that table was deleted.

item.title: CVE-2022-2585|2024-08-03T00:39:08.282Z -- the%20linux%20kernel%20organization -- linux
item.description: It was discovered that when exec'ing from a non-leader thread, armed POSIX CPU timers would be left on a list but freed, leading to a use-after-free.

item.title: CVE-2022-2602|2024-08-03T00:46:03.143Z -- the%20linux%20kernel%20organization -- linux
item.description: io_uring UAF, Unix SCM garbage collection

item.title: CVE-2022-2588|2024-08-03T00:39:08.044Z -- the%20linux%20kernel%20organization -- linux
item.description: It was discovered that the cls_route filter implementation in the Linux kernel would not remove an old filter from the hashtable before freeing it if its handle had the value 0.

item.title: CVE-2021-3600|2024-08-03T17:01:07.551Z -- the%20linux%20kernel%20organization -- linux
item.description: It was discovered that the eBPF implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly track bounds information for 32 bit registers when performing div and mod operations. A local attacker could use this to possibly execute arbitrary code.
